# iBridge Website Project - Copilot Instructions

This is a professional BPO/BPaaS company website for iBridge Contact Solutions. When working on this project, please follow these guidelines:

## Project Overview
- **Company**: iBridge Contact Solutions (Pty) Ltd
- **Industry**: Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) & Business Process as a Service (BPaaS)
- **Target**: Professional B2B services website
- **Technology Stack**: HTML5, CSS3 (with CSS Variables), Vanilla JavaScript

## Code Style & Standards
- Use semantic HTML5 elements
- Follow CSS custom properties (CSS variables) for theming
- Write accessible code with proper ARIA labels
- Use modern JavaScript (ES6+) with proper error handling
- Maintain responsive design principles (mobile-first)
- Follow BEM methodology for CSS class naming where applicable

## Design System
- **Primary Color**: #a1c44f (green)
- **Secondary Color**: #2c3e50 (dark blue)
- **Typography**: Montserrat (primary), Playfair Display (headings)
- **Design Style**: Modern, professional, clean, corporate

## Key Features to Maintain
- Responsive navigation with mobile menu
- Smooth scrolling and animations
- Contact forms with validation
- WhatsApp integration
- Social media links
- SEO optimization with structured data
- Accessibility features (skip links, keyboard navigation)

## Content Guidelines
- Professional, business-focused tone
- Emphasize founder-led excellence
- Highlight BPO/BPaaS expertise
- Include contact information for South African business
- Focus on KPIs, customer experience, and business growth

## File Structure
- `/css/styles.css` - Main stylesheet
- `/js/main.js` - Main JavaScript functionality
- `/images/` - All image assets
- `/partials/` - Reusable HTML components
- Root level HTML files for different pages

## When Adding New Features
- Ensure mobile responsiveness
- Add proper accessibility attributes
- Test keyboard navigation
- Maintain consistent styling with existing design system
- Include proper error handling in JavaScript
- Follow the existing code patterns and conventions
